reasoningQuestions.questionText: A $!$1.00 kg$!$ block of ice at $!$0^\circ C$!$ is left outside where the air temperature is $!$25^\circ C$!$. The specific latent heat of fusion of ice is $!$336 kJ/kg$!$. What is the change in entropy of the ice-air system when the ice block completely melts?

answerOptions.optionText: Compute heat required to melt the ice using the formula $!$Q = mL$!$
Calculate entropy gain of the ice using the formula $!$\Delta S = \frac{\Delta Q}{T}$!$, where $!$T=273 K$!$
Calculate entropy loss of air using the formula $!$\Delta S = \frac{\Delta Q}{T}$!$, where $!$T=298 K$!$
Calculate entropy change of the ice-air system using the formula $!$\Delta S = \Delta S_{ice} + \Delta S_{air}$!$
Calculate entropy loss of ice using the formula $!$\Delta S = \frac{\Delta Q}{T}$!$, where $!$T=273 K$!$
Calculate entropy gain of air using the formula $!$\Delta S = \frac{\Delta Q}{T}$!$, where $!$T=298 K$!$
Find entropy change of the ice-air system using the formula $!$\Delta S = \Delta S_{ice} - \Delta S_{air}$!$
Calculate entropy loss of air using the formula $!$\Delta S = \frac{\Delta Q}{T}$!$, where $!$T=285.5 K$!$
Calculate entropy gain of ice using the formula $!$\Delta S = \frac{\Delta Q}{T}$!$, where $!$T=285.5 K$!$

reasoningQuestions.questionText: A Carnot engine operates using an ideal gas. In each cycle, the gas absorbs $!$20000J$!$ of energy from the hot reservoir and releases $!$12000J$!$ of energy to the cold reservoir. If the cold reservoir is maintained at $!$27^\circ C$!$, what temperature $!$T^\circ C$!$ must the hot reservoir be kept at?

answerOptions.optionText: Find efficiency of the engine using the formula $!$\eta = 1 - \frac{Q_c}{Q_h}$!$, where $!$Q_c=12000 J$!$
Calculate temperature of hot reservoir using the formula $!$\eta = 1 - \frac{T_c}{T_h} and convert to degree Celsius$!$
Find efficiency of the engine using the formula $!$\eta = \frac{Q_c}{Q_h}$!$
Calculate temperature of hot reservoir using the formula $!$\eta = 1 - \frac{T_c}{T_h} and convert to Kelvin$!$
Calculate temperature of hot reservoir using the formula $!$\eta = 1 - \frac{T_c}{T_h}$!$
